title: Dual Targeting of Norepinephrine Transporter (NET) Function and Thyrointegrin αvβ3 Receptors in the Treatment of Neuroblastoma

reactions.text: In the next reaction, compound 2 was reacted with commercially available Br-PEG400-N3 in the presence of potassium carbonate and acetone under reflux conditions to get compound 3 with 87% yield. The 1H NMR spectrum of compound 3 (Figure S3) exhibited new peaks at 3.40 and 3.67 ppm, which can be assigned to PEG protons.

Na ascorbate in THF/water (10:1) was used to generate Cu+ in situ at 65 °C, and flash chromatography was used to purify the resulting compound with DCM/MeOH (95:5). The characteristic singlet proton peak of the triazole ring, formed after click reaction, appeared at 8.51 ppm in the 1H NMR spectrum of compound 6 (Figure S12). Finally, the protecting Boc groups on the BG were removed in 4 N HCl (in dioxane), and the resulting product was purified with reverse-phase column chromatography with MeOH/water (70:30) to get compound 7, BG-P-TAT, in 70% yield.

Na ascorbate in THF/water (10:1) was used to generate Cu+ in situ at 65 °C, and flash chromatography was used to purify the resulting compound with DCM/MeOH (95:5). The characteristic singlet proton peak of the triazole ring, formed after click reaction, appeared at 8.51 ppm in the 1H NMR spectrum of compound 6 (Figure S12). Finally, the protecting Boc groups on the BG were removed in 4 N HCl (in dioxane), and the resulting product was purified with reverse-phase column chromatography with MeOH/water (70:30) to get compound 7, BG-P-TAT, in 70% yield.

4-Hydroxybenzylamine (0.62 g, 5 mmol) was slowly added with stirring to a solution of di-tert-butyl dicarbonate (1.2 g, 5.1 mmol) at room temperature. After stirring for 8 h, the oily residue was purified using column chromatography [SiO2: EtOAc/hexanes (1:4)] to afford 0.82 g of N-Boc-4-hydroxybenzylamine as a colorless oil with 71% yield.

Compound 3 (325 mg, 0.57 mmol) was dissolved in 3 mL of anhydrous 1,4-dioxane and 3 mL of HCl (4 N in dioxane) and stirred at room temperature. After 24 h, the solvent was removed under reduced pressure, and the oily residue was precipitated with stirring in diethyl ether to afford 4 as a yellowish solid with yield 240 mg, 90%. Purity >98%, tR

Compound 6 (100 mg) was dissolved in 3 mL of anhydrous 1,4-dioxane and then 6 mL of HCl (4 N in dioxane) was added and stirred at room temperature. After 24 h, the solvent was removed under reduced pressure, and the oily residue was precipitated with diethyl ether to afford compound 7 as a white powder, which was purified with reverse-phase column chromatography [C18: MeOH/water (70:30)] with yield: 60 mg, 70%.
